title: AI Health Risk Predictor
description: Health-related ml model to predict smoking status using bio-signal data,
longDescription: A Machine Learning Model that I contributed to making in a datathon. The model was used to predict the smoker status of individuals using bio-signal data and physiological signal features. The project was evaluated on Area Under the ROC Curve (AUC) between the predicted probability and the observed target.

title: Community Connect
description: Cross-platform mobile app based on location-based volunteer matching for elderly users.
longDescription: Developed a proof-of-concept mobile application facilitating assistance requests, leveraging OpenAI's GPT-4 for AI-driven categorization and implementing geolocation features to connect elders with nearby volunteers.

title: XpenseWise
longDescription: Developed a Python app capable of managing over 100 daily expenses to log, categorize, and track these daily expenses with personalized budget management.

title: Shuri’s Gauntlet – Web-Based Minigame
description: A hacker-themed multi-stage web and console minigame built in BisonHacks
longDescription: Shuri’s Gauntlet is a collaborative hackathon project featuring an interactive multi-level game blending web and terminal-based gameplay. Players take on missions with AI companions and complete puzzles or challenges across different interfaces. This hybrid structure teaches programming, logic, and storytelling while simulating a cybersecurity-themed experience

title: Book Review Sentiment Classifier
description: Bidirectional LSTM–based NLP model to classify book reviews as positive or negative.
longDescription: Built an end-to-end sentiment analysis pipeline using Word2Vec embeddings and a Bidirectional LSTM (via TensorFlow Keras) to predict whether a book review is positive. The project covers data cleaning, tokenization, embedding training, model architecture design, and evaluation with accuracy and ROC‐AUC metrics.

title: Summer AI Research Project Blog
description: Jekyll-powered summer research blog I made to document daily reflections and project insights.
longDescription: Built a personal research website with Jekyll and the Minimal theme to chronicle summer AI work: daily learning posts, mentor spotlights, and a detailed project overview. Integrated GitHub Pages for CI/CD, custom SCSS overrides, and multiple layouts (_posts, pages, mentor, project) for a polished, easy-to-navigate blog.
